decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: AR/PL/101A, 102A, 103A, 104, 105A & site location plan.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match those of the existing building in materials, style, colour, texture and, in the case of brickwork, bonding, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no windows other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the flank wall of the extension at first floor level without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The proposed two storey side extension is acceptable in design and does not detract from the appearance of the adjacent Mitcham Crciket Green   Conservation Area. It accords with the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.

London Borough of Merton's UDP (2003)
BE.3: Development adjacent to a conservation area 
BE.15: New Buildings & Extensions
BE.16: Urban Design
BE.22: Design of New Development
BE.23: Alterations & Extension to buildings
PK.3: Car Parking & Development

Supplementary Planning Guidance: Residential Extensions, Alterations and Conversions (2001)

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE. 
You are advised that this permission does not confer or imply to confer that the enlarged dwelling may be used for anything other than a single family dwelling. Use for a purpose other than as a single family dwelling would be unlawful and constitute a breach of planning control.
